questionParts: Find the general solution of the system:
options: x(t) = A t e^{t} + B e^{t}
explanationParts: Eigenvalues: λ = 1 and λ = -1 with eigenvectors [1, 0] and [1, -1].
Solution: x(t) = A e^{t} v₁ + B e^{-t} v₂.

questionParts: Diagonalize M = [[0, 2], [-1, 2]] over ℝ and describe the general form of the solution.
options: x(t) = e^{2t} (α cos(t) v₁ + β sin(t) v₂)
x(t) = A t v + B w
questions.correctAnswer: x(t) = e^{2t} (α cos(t) v₁ + β sin(t) v₂)
explanationParts: Matrix M has complex eigenvalues 1 ± i.
The real solution is formed by exponentials multiplied by sine and cosine.
This is the canonical form for complex eigenvalue systems.
